p: Although pet ownership creates an increased risk during disasters, companion animals simultaneously increase resilience for humans (Thompson et al. 2014). Companion animals reduce distress associated with traumatic events, and the human–animal bond can act as a strong support following disasters (Thompson 2013). The strength of the human–companion animal bond therefore warrants proper consideration during disaster preparation and management. Continued research on the human–companion animal relationship during crises will certainly serve to better prepare for impacts of future pandemics and other disasters.
